author: sproul
content:
My DB was also created by hand, although I considered using Python's `ast` module to crawl the Python spec. I don't think you need any of the text/markdown for this sort of analysis.

I went through function by function, recording the call graph in this CSV file: <https://github.com/sigp/verified-consensus/blob/main/call_db/function_calls.csv>. I also made separate tables of the fields read and written by each function directly. The sqlite database takes this per-function data and allows you to run queries across the whole graph like "which functions modify this field", or "which functions call this function", etc
